Sentencas: La0.2Sr0.25Ca0.45TiO3 is a carefully selected composition to provide optimal ceramic and electrical characteristics for use as an anode support in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Preparation via a solution method of La0.2Sr0.25Ca0.45TiO3 and its characterization for anode supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study we focus on the process optimization and characterization of A-site deficient perovskite, La0.2Sr0.25Ca0.45TiO3 (LSCTA-), powders prepared via a solution method to be integrated into the SOFC anode supports.
Titulo: Preparation via a solution method of La0.2Sr0.25Ca0.45TiO3 and its characterization for anode supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A Pechini method has been applied to successfully produce single phase perovskite at 900 degrees C. Processing conditions have been modified to yield a powder that displays a similar sintering profile to commercial yttria stabilised zirconia.
Titulo: Preparation via a solution method of La0.2Sr0.25Ca0.45TiO3 and its characterization for anode supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The conductivity behavior of porous bodies under redox has been investigated showing a 2 stage process in both oxidation and reduction cycling that exhibits strong reversibility.
Titulo: Preparation via a solution method of La0.2Sr0.25Ca0.45TiO3 and its characterization for anode supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For the reduction process, addition of impregnated ceria reduces the onset delay period and increases the apparent rate constant, k values, by 30-50% for both stages.
Titulo: Preparation via a solution method of La0.2Sr0.25Ca0.45TiO3 and its characterization for anode supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The addition of ceria had less influence on the oxidation kinetics, although the conductivity values of both oxidised and reduced porous bodies were enhanced.
Titulo: Preparation via a solution method of La0.2Sr0.25Ca0.45TiO3 and its characterization for anode supported solid oxide fuel cells
